title: Type in magazine 'Shop till you drop'
content:
My girlfriend buys the magazine [’Shop till you drop’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172818/http:/www.shoptilyoudrop.com.au/) and the other day i saw the cover for the current issue and thought ’hang on, that’s really nice type...’ Three of the types used i love but have no idea what they are, can someone help please?

Here is the cover which has sample of all the types i’m after (click for larger image) [http://www.magshop.com.au/?id=150&CID=10446](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172818/http:/www.magshop.com.au/?id=150&CID=10446 "http://www.magshop.com.au/?id=150&CID=10446")

The first is the script used to say ’till you drop’ on the logo.

The second is a sans used for some body copy, headings, and product info.

The third is a handwriting script used heaps in the mag.

Any help would be really helpful.

I can try to get scans if needed.

cheers - sye :)

 [‹ Type needs identifying](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172818/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43111 "Go to previous forum topic") [Bicycle playing card fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172818/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43105 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Simon Robertson

comments.content: Well, most of that type is Neutraface from House.
awesome, thanks! now anyone got ideas for the scripts...

“til you drop” looks similar to [Nothing](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172818/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/nothing/) from Flat-it and [Satisfaction](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172818/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/satisfaction/) from E-phemera.

“til you drop” is [Petra Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172818/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/petras-script/)

[EDIT] Eeh, I didn’t refresh in a while.
thank you all! hmm.... now to check my credit card balance....
